Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior a cambiado las condiciones del negocio siendo más rentable y dándole mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana needs to purchase more products to stock her business with rice, oil, sugar, eggs and cheese, which will allow her to improve and grow her inventory.  She knows that with the previous loan she received, the condition of her business has changed for the better, becoming more profitable and giving her higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Shafik

texts.en:
Shafik is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past six years, Shafik has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells hardware materials. 

To help expand his business, Shafik has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hardware materials for resale, and will help Shafik to generate greater profits and increase the capital in his business. Shafik hopes that in the future he will be able to have a very big business.

Shafik is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shafik who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hardware materials for resale

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando is a 41-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has six children, the oldest of whom is 22 years old.

Servando has been working as a fisherman for quite some time now. He earns about 4,800 PHP per month doing this fishing. He requested a loan to purchase nylon, fishing nets, and gasoline for the boat. Servando hopes to earn more and be able to send all his children to school. He also hopes to elevate his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, fishing nets, and gasoline for the boat

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past eight years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her inventory of charcoal, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and buy family needs like food. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful business woman. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her charcoal inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past 10 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities for her business, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and change her children's lives into better ones. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful business woman. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities for her business

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa Estela recently opened a new restaurant to supplement her clothing and electronic goods business. She is 43 years old and married with three children who are 12, 20, and 22. In the photo, she is pictured with her granddaughter. For a number of years, Rosa Estela has purchased clothing and electronic goods from the border between Chile and Peru, and brought them to Cusco where she sells them. 

Currently, she is focusing on her new restaurant, and is requesting a loan in order to buy tables and large pots, and add another kitchen. The restaurant serves typical Peruvian food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Rosa Estela would like to open another location and thereby grow her business into a chain of restaurants. 

Rosa Estela is a member of the village bank "Prosperidad" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Rosa Estela recently opened a new restaurant to supplement her clothing and electronic goods business. She is 43 years old and married with three children who are 12, 20, and 22. In the photo, she is pictured with her granddaughter. For a number of years, Rosa Estela has purchased clothing and electronic goods from the border between Chile and Peru, and brought them to Cusco where she sells them. 

Currently, she is focusing on her new restaurant, and is requesting a loan in order to buy tables and large pots, and add another kitchen. The restaurant serves typical Peruvian food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Rosa Estela would like to open another location and thereby grow her business into a chain of restaurants. 

Rosa Estela is a member of the village bank "Prosperidad" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy tables and large pots, and add another kitchen to her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cotton dresses, low-heeled slippers, ladies bags, and blouses

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is 52 years old and lives with his wife Narine, a 25-year-old daughter, and 22-year-old son. He lives in Ninotsminda District, Southern part of Georgia. Norik mainly works on renovation projects in his district. Narine works as a milkmaid in a local farm. 

Along with their main jobs, the family runs a small scale agricultural business. They grow potatoes on a family owned plot of land. Norik sells harvested potatoes locally to grocery wholesalers. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Laris.

Norik requested a loan to purchase potatoes for sowing. He will purchase a better quality of potatoes than he grew before. Narine and Norik will work hard during the spring and summer to get a good harvest in early summer. They hope to increase income to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing on his farm land.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 51 years old and is married with 7 children ranging from ages 10 to 24 years old. She earns a living by selling bread to her community.

Rizalina and her husband work together in their bread business. They bake the bread and use their motorcycle to deliver bread to their customers. 
Rizalina does her best to sell quality bread to her community.

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients like flour and sugar for making the bread, and to use for motorcycle maintenance to deliver the bread. Rizalina hopes to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour and sugar to make bread for her business, and to maintain her motorcycle so she can deliver the bread.

loans.name: Munay Soncco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal MUNAY  SONCCO; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Eduardina tiene 22 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros, a la vez la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de comida  ella ejerce este negocio solo en las mañanas en un mercado en la ciudad de Cusco y por las tardes atiende su tienda de abarrotes siendo su esposo quien le ayuda por las mañanas  en la tienda  de abarrotes mientras la socia vende la comida a sus clientes que le solicitan,  la socia es una persona empeñosa y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante día a día siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas,gaseosas entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de fruta, compra y venta de productos agrícolas, brindando  servico de taxi y urbano, panadería,tienda de abarrotes .

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Munay Soncco” communal bank located in Wanchaq District in Cusco Province and Cusco Department

Eduardina, 22, has a spouse and two children. She alternates her daily chores with a grocery store business; she sells various types of products like rice, sugar, milk, snacks and soft-drinks, among others.  At the same time she runs a food selling business but only in the morning in one of Cusco’s markets.  She tends to her grocery store in the afternoons and it’s her husband who looks after the store in the morning while she’s selling the food her customers request.  She is a very dedicated, responsible person who very much wants to get ahead day to day since this is the way she moves her family ahead.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise for her store like rice, sugar, milk, snacks and soft-drinks, among others.

The other group members are fruit merchants, farm products merchants, provide urban taxi service, bakery and grocery store.

She is grateful for this means of getting credit and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amanecer De Los Inkas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Amanecer de los Inkas” está conformado por seis varones y cinco mujeres. La mayoría de los socios son amigos, compañeros de trabajo y vecinos que tienen una buena amistad. Los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico, sus paisajes, su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo venta de comestibles, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de artesanía, venta de cerveza y otros brindan servicios. 

La socia Lourdes tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y fruto esta unión tienen tres hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica de  Lourdes es la venta de comestibles y tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Lourdes requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Ella compra al por mayor sus productos pues le sale más barato y por lo tanto la tienda esta surtida de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: The community bank "Amanecer de los Inkas" (Dawn of the Incas) consists of six men and five women.  The majority of the members are friends, workmates and neighbors that have a close friendship together.  The members live in the city of Cusco, a city which is characterized by its archeological centers, its historical center, its landscapes, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of Peru.  The members are workers and entrepreneurs that at all times are searching for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort to be able to offer a better future to their children.  The majority of the members make a living in different businesses, such as selling groceries, selling vegetables, selling prepared food, selling artisan crafts, selling beer others work in the service industry.  Lourdes, a 33 year old member, is married and has three children, was born in the province of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  Lourdes' business is the sale of groceries and she has a small store in her home.  At this time, Lourdes requires a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her store, such as sacks of rice and sugar and other supplies.  She purchases her products wholesale seeing as it is more economical, and as a result of these purchases, the store is stocked with staple products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar as well as other supplies.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Deysi; ella es conviviente y tiene 24 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de pollo y pescado, ella envía estos productos a lugares como Puerto Maldonado, ella envía en su propio camión, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos y pescados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollo y pescados al por mayor.
Los dos socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo,es por eso que no estuvieron en la reunion.

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de vidrios, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de  venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Deysi, 24, has a spouse and two children.  She works selling chicken and fish.  She sends these products to places like Puerto Maldonado in her own truck.  She supports her children through this business.  Her dream is to own a locale where she can sell chicken and fish. She’s asking for the loan to buy chicken and fish at wholesale.

The two members stuck to the group photo requested permission due to work and that’s why they weren’t at the meeting.

The other members sell glass, crafts, groceries and clothes.

The members thank those who participate in this dream through this means and commits to make her installment payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Erick Francisco

texts.es:
Erick Francisco  vive en compañía de su mamá en su casa propia,  es un joven que se dedica a la  enseñanza a  niños  de dicho municipio. Actualmente está pasando dificultades ya que su humilde casa se encuentra en   malas  condiciones. Tuvo la oportunidad  a través de sus amistades de  informarse que Ceprodel apoya  a estas personas  a mejorar su  calidad de vida.

Se presentó por primera vez para solicitar un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, y zinc. Estos  materiales de construcción los necesitan con urgencia para poder reparar su vivienda,  Espera en nuestra institución que le brinde esta  ayuda,  y este  sea otorgado para así iniciar su obra, y alcanzar su meta de tener un techo digno y seguro para  su familia.
texts.en:
Erick Francisco lives with his mom in his own home.  He is a young man whose job is teaching children in the town where he lives.  He is currently experiencing some difficulties because his humble home is in a bad state of repair.  He found out that Ceprodel support people in improving their quality of life through some friends.

Erick Francisco came to Ceprodel for the first time to request a loan so that he could buy cement, sand and metal sheets.  He needs these building supplies urgently in order to repair his home.  He hopes that our institution will help him and that he will receive a loan so that he can start his work and achieve his goal of having a safe and decent home for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal sheets

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es: Martha Maria tiene 25 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería ya tiene años de tenerla, este negocio lo inicia con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha salido adelante con sus dos hijos que todavía está a su cargo y están estudiando. M	artha Maria está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos y brindarle a sus clientes variedad de productos lo cual compara granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, jabón, pan, azúcar, entre otros productos que más demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha María, 25, has a grocery store; she’s had it for years.  She started the business with her own funds and with much effort and dedication has gotten ahead with her two children who are still in her care and attending school.

Martha María is asking for financing to buy merchandise and provide her customers with a variety of products.  She will buy basic grains, rice, beans, oil, eggs, soap, bread and sugar among other products her customers request.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rita Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer de 52 años, es una persona muy amigable, muy feliz y muy trabajadora. Rita vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Rita trabaja sola en la elaboración de tejidos de lanas como sacos, es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito va a invertir en la compra de lana al por mayor, ya que necesita incrementar su producción para mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Rita sueña en contratar tejedoras y ponerse un taller grande para distribuir en grande.
texts.en:
Rita is a very friendly, happy and very hardworking, 52 year old woman.  Rita lives with her husband and three children in the city of Ibarra, Imbabura Province.

Rita works knitting woolen items like coats.  This is the first time she’s worked with Fodemi and will use the loan to buy wool yarn at wholesale because she needs to increase production in order to improve income and quality of life.

Rita dreams with hiring knitters and installing a large workshop so that she can sell in large scale.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Leydin Karina

texts.es:
Leydin Karina habitante del Sauce, actualmente  desempeña el cargo de cajera, es madre de un niño el cual depende de ella, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, espíritu emprendedor, tuvo la oportunidad de conocer un poco acerca de  Ceprodel. El apoyo que el brinda a personas que tienen la necesidad de medicinas para mejorar su salud.

Por esta razón  se presentó a nuestra institución para solicitar un crédito, para la compra de medicamentos,  ya que no esta a su alcance adquirir completamente el tratamiento para  combatir sus enfermedades, ya que  ha estado un poquito mal. Lo que mas anhela es gozar de buena salud para seguir cuidando de su hijo y salir adelante. El apoyo que espera la  motiva a seguir luchando para lograr vivir en una vida más saludable
texts.en:
Leydin Karina lives in El Sauce and currently works as a cashier.  She is the mother of one son who is still dependent on her.  Leydin is a woman who has a great desire to do well in life and she has an enterprising spirit.  She had the opportunity of finding out a little bit about Ceprodel and the support that they give people who need medicines in order to improve their health.

For this reason, Leydin came to our institution to request a loan with which to buy medicines.  She is not able to acquire all of the medicines she needs to fight her illnesses.  She has been a little sick.  What she most wishes for is to enjoy good health so that she can continue caring for her son and making progress in life.  The support that she hopes for encourages her to continue working hard so that she can manage to live a more healthy life.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 7 years, Milly has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and other goods. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock, which will help Milly to generate greater profits and improve the quality of her life. Milly hopes that in the future she will be become self reliant and live a good life. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa la cual lo apoya en todo lo que el emprende, juntos tienen 6 hijos y su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, además de ser conocida como la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, además de ser conocida por la  buena sazón que tienen sus pobladores para la preparación de platillos, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”.

Con mucha dedicación Humberto se dedica a su negocio como albañil, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas al día, pero depende del tipo de construcción que el haga; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y tiene buenos acabados.

Humberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una maquina mezcladora para cemento, con lo cual le permitirá tener una herramienta muy necesaria en su trabajo y así dar mejor servicio a sus cliente lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño.” Tener contratos con empresas grandes”.
texts.en:
Humberto is 55 years old living with his wife who supports him in everything he does.  They have six children together and their house is located in the city of Chincha, a city noted for its hot climate, beautiful beaches and also for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  It’s also well known for its cuisine; its residents are known for preparing very tasty dishes and one of his favorites is the very delicious “Carapulcra con sopa seca” [pork with noodles].

With much dedication, Humberto works as a bricklayer.  He works about 9 hours per day depending on the type of construction job he has.  He believes that he does well in his business because he does good jobs with good finishings.

Humberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy a cement mixer which will allow him to have a very necessary work tool to provide better service to his customers which will make it possible for him to continue working and striving toward making his dream a reality: “To have contracts with large firms.”

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Joven Guadalupe actualmente se desempeña como Secretaria en un centro educativo ubicado en el Municipio del Sauce, es madre de dos hijos los cuales están bajo su cargo, ella tiene muchos deseos de superación por cual  motivo es que recurre a Ceprodel, que apoya a las personas a dar bienestar  a sus familias. 

Por esta razón  se presentó para solicitar un crédito, para la compra de electrodomésticos  (Televisor y un equipo de sonido),  para tener una  mejor calidad de  vida, con mucho esfuerzo lucha para salir adelante, impulsado con la esperanza que se le conceda el crédito, agradeciendo la oportunidad que le puedan brindar para cumplir  sus metas de vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Guadalupe currently works as a secretary in an educational center, in the town of El Sauce.  She is the mother of two children who are both in her care.  She has a great desire to do well in life and so she came to Ceprodel who support people who want to provide for their familys' well-being.

Guadalupe came to request a loan in order to buy some electrical appliances (a television set and some sound equipment) so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.  She works very hard to make progress in life and is encouraged by the hope that she will receive a loan.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she may be given to achieve her goal of living in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Kuska Llankasun De Rumichaca Baja Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca Baja” está conformado por cinco varones y nueve mujeres. La mayoría de los socios son amigos, compañeros de trabajo y vecinos que tienen una buena amistad. Los socios viven en la ciudad de Urubamba en la asociación pro vivienda de Cotowincho.

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  La mayoría de los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como crianza de animales menores, cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de artesanía, comestibles y otros brindan servicios. 

La socia Yanet tiene 27 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica de Yanet es la compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes. Yanet y su esposo se dedican también a la fabricación de muebles de madera como sillas, mesas, camas, puertas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera. 

(La  socia que no aparece en la fotografía pidiò permiso a la junta directiva para no estar presente en la reunión).
texts.en:
The “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca Baja” communal bank is made up of five men and nine women.  Most of the members are friends, coworkers, and neighbors with a good relationship.  They live in the Cotowincho settlement of Urubamba.

The members are hardworking, enterprising, and in search of opportunities to get ahead and provide a better future for their children through their daily efforts.  Most of the members have different businesses, such as raising livestock, cosmetic sales, vegetable sales, arts and crafts, food, and other services.

Yanet is 27 years old; is in a live-in relationship and they have three children.  She was born in the Urubamba province and lives in the same city where she was born.  Yanet buys and sells small animals, such as Guinea pigs.  She and her husband also make wooden furniture, such as chairs, beds, doors, and other things.  Yanet needs this loan to buy supplies such as lumber.

(This member does not appear in the photograph.  She got permission from the board not to attend the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Juana Lucelinda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen  4 hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad y estudian en universidad, los menores son mellizos, tiene 10 años de edad y están en el último año de escuela. Su esposo es maestro de escuela. 

Ella es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que además de atender su hogar también trabaja de maestra en una escuela local y se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas en la escuela y de tarde recorre por la localidad para ofrecer sus productos, ella les vende a sus compañeras de trabajo ya que son sus mejores clientes.  Deja a crédito y cobra los sabados o domingos cada semana, lleva más de 6 años dedicada a sus ventas y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar: ropa y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de dos años y le gusta por la ayuda del grupo.
 
Sus metas son continuar con su negocio y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
In Manabí Province’s 24 de Mayo Canton known for its beautiful scenery, forests and variety of fauna and for its hardworking residents who are farmers and raise animals, the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For A Better Future) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

Juana, 42, lives here.  She’s married and has four children.  Two of them are adults and attend university and the younger ones are 10 year old twins attending the final year in elementary school.  Her husband is a school teacher.

She is a very good wife and housewife who besides tending to her home also works as a teacher in a local school.  She’s also a merchant selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics and women’s accessories).  She works every day at school in the morning and during the afternoon wanders through her locality selling her products.  She sells to fellow workers who are her best customers.  She sells on credit collecting payment on Saturday or Sunday each week.  She’s been in sales for more than 6 years and she does very well.

This loan is to buy clothes and Yanbal products.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than two years and likes it because of the group support.  Her goals are to continue with her business and to improve it.

loans.use: to buy clothes and Yambal brand products.

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azucar De Sacllo Group

texts.es:
Sacllo está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los antiguos Inkas, Sacllo se caracteriza por tener zonas agrícolas y ganaderas, Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo”, actualmente se encuentra en el XVI ciclo, el banco comunal está conformado por doce mujeres y un varón que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las comunidad de Sacllo. Las actividades económicas de los socias a las que se dedican son por ejemplo a la venta de verduras, venta de comestibles, venta de frutas, venta de chicha, venta de leche, venta de golosinas y venta de animales menores y un socio brinda servicio de docencia. 

Basilia forma parte del banco comunal, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Basilia nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos sin ayuda de su pareja. Su actividad económica de Basilia es la venta de verduras, crianza de animales menores y venta de chicha de jora. En esta oportunidad Basilia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores y semillas. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The community of Sacllo is in the district and province of Calca in the department of Cusco in the centre of the Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley) of the Inkas. Sacllo is known as a farming region, livestock and agriculture. Years ago, a group of female friends formed the Communal Bank, “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo” (God of Bread and Sugar of Sacllo) and now find themselves in their 16th loan cycle. This group is formed by 12 women and 1 man – all are hard-working entrepreneurs who search for opportunities to get ahead and with their everyday efforts, hope to offer their children a better future. All of the members live in Sacllo. The businesses of the members include vegetable sales, food sales, fruit sales, chicha (alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) sales, milk sales, candy sales and small animal sales, and one member offers teaching services.

Basilia, a member of the Communal Bank, is single and has 3 kids. Basilia tells us with much pride that that she is getting ahead with her children, without the help of her partner. Basilia sells vegetables, breeds small animals and sells chicha (alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) made from jora (specially-prepared maize). Basilia is requesting the loan to buy more small animals and seeds.

The members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and promise to meet their payments on schedule.

loans.use: buy more small animals and seeds.

loans.name: Linda Phebe

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Linda. She is married, and has one child aged two. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to help with the household chores. In 2004, Linda established her fish business. She began her business because she wants to be self-sustaining. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about Le 1,400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. 

Linda has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now needs a new loan in order to buy additional fish. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Linda plans to expand to other areas of the town. She thinks the loan can help her improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for fish.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Kadiatu. She is married, and has three children aged ten, six, and four. In 2000, Kadiatu established her cooking condiment business. She began her business to help her husband take care of their home. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. 

Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now needs a new loan to buy additional cooking condiments. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a shop, to educate her children to the university level, and to have more motor bikes as transport. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for maggi oil, rice, and seasonings.

loans.name: Edward T

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Edward. He is married, and has three children aged three, seven, and fourteen. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help with the household chores. In 2009, Edward established his food and drinks business. He began his business because of the high profit earned in food and drinks. Working six days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. 

Edward has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now needs a new loan in order to increase his stock and improve the musical facilities. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Edward plans to secure another building in this business location. He is grateful to ARD for the support, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for food and drinks.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de su fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Lucia, tiene 49 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor que en escuela. Ella vive sola con sus hijos.

Ella trabaja de empleada pública en el cuerpo de bomberos de 24 de mayo y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa e interior, sobrecamas, toallas entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella recorre en las noches y los fines de semana  con la ayudan su hija.  Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita,  lleva más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, pantalones, camisas y ropa interior para estudiantes ya que están por iniciar las clases y es cuando estos productos se venden más. Está en el Banco Comunal por más de 11 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio y está muy agradecida con la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran local y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
In Manabí Province’s 24 de Mayo Canton known for its beautiful scenery, forests and variety of fauna and for its hardworking residents who are farmers and raise animals, the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For A Better Future) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

We met Lucia, 49, here.  She’s a single mother of two children who are 16 and 10 years old.  The older one attends secondary school and the younger one is in elementary school.  She lives alone with her children.

She’s a public employee in the 24 de Mayo fire department and is also a merchant; she sells clothes, underwear, bedspreads and towels, among others.  She sells door to door during evenings and on the weekend; her daughter helps her.  She sells on credit and collects payments every eight days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to.  She’s been in this line of work for 11 years and does very well.

This loan is to buy sheets, pants, shirts and underwear for students since they are about to start classes and this is when these products sell best.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 11 years and likes it because she was able to start her business with her first loan and she’s very grateful to the institution.  Her dreams are to have a large store and to be a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy sheets, pants, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Sallieu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Sallieu. He is married, and has three children aged fifteen, twelve, and nine. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to go to high school. In 1997, Sallieu established his used clothing business. He began his business because it was the only way he had to gain economic and financial freedom. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. 

Sallieu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy quality used clothing in the neighboring country Guinea. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Sallieu plans to build a house and to educate his children to higher level. With the loan, he hopes to increase his capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has two children, aged six and one. He has three additional dependents, who live with him to assist in the shop. In 1997, Mohamed established his building materials business. He began his business to earn income for the family. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. 

Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his supply of building materials. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to be a supplier to industries and contractors. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for building materials.

loans.name: Angelica Liliana

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, por la variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
La señora Angélica tiene 37 años de edad, está divorciada, pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad que estudian  en el colegio. 

Ella para salir adelante y para que a sus hijos nunca les faltara nada desde hace mas de 10 años se  dedica al comercio, vende productos de  Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas), ropa y zapatos por catálogos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local y hasta  donde sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, vende a crédito y al contado. La ropa y los zapatos se los envían desde Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar: ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes y accesorios de damas. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace más de tres años y le gusta por la forma de trabajar en la institución.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Manabí Province’s 24 de Mayo Canton known for its beautiful scenery, forests and variety of fauna and for its hardworking residents who are farmers and raise animals, the “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mother For A Better Future) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

Angélica is 37 years old, divorced and has two children who are 16 and 12 years old and attend secondary school.  In order to get ahead and so that her children would have everything they need she’s been a merchant for more than ten years.  She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories), and clothes and shoes via catalogue.  She sells door to door and also from home where she has a small locale that her customers can visit.  She works every day from 8:30am until 4pm.  Her sales are cash and credit.  The clothes and shoes are shipped to her from Guayaquil.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, creams, perfume and women’s accessories.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for more than three years and she likes it because of the way the institution operates.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, creams, perfume and women's accessories.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 17 años, en el municipio de Soledad, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene dos negocios, vende mercancía variada y también comidas; su idea de negocio ocurrió  desde hace 3 años, buscando la oportunidad de obtener ingresos suficientes para lograr cada vez mas su bienestar y el de su familia, hasta ese momento a cargo de su esposo. Su clientela que le compra alimentos, está ubicada en el barrio donde habita y la que le compra mercancías variadas en el centro del municipio de Soledad  y a ellos les vende  directamente  puerta a puerta.  Mientras sus compras las hace de contado, las ventas las hace a crédito, por eso su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para responderle a una nueva clientela y esto es justamente la razón pro la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías variadas encargadas por sus clientes, inversión que tendrá éxito porque rotará rápidamente pues está en marcada en resolver sus necesidades de consumo.
texts.en: Maria lives with her spouse and three children, ages 10 and 17, in the town of Soledad, twenty minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  There she has two businesses; she sells assorted merchandise and also sells food.  She came up with the idea of starting the business three years ago. She was looking for the opportunity to earn enough income to increasingly improve her welfare and that of her family, which had been her husband’s responsibility up until that time. Customers who buy meals from her are located in the neighborhood where she lives, and she sells assorted merchandise door-to-door directly to customers in Soledad’s town center.  She makes her purchases in cash. However, she makes her sales on credit and consequently, her greatest challenge is to have the enough working capital in order to meet the demands of her new customers. This is exactly the reason she has come to Kiva to request her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy assorted merchandise to fill customer orders, and the investment will be successful because goods will rotate quickly since they are bought with customers’ needs in mind.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has a daughter. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a restaurant where he sells tea, food, snacks, etc. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of food ingredients. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients. His business goal is to expand his business and venture into a wholesale retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for selling.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
1.	Miriam es una señora de 48 años de edad y  vive con su familia, en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Desde hace algún tiempo se dedica a la ganadería,  su proyecto es la compra y venta de ganado de doble propósito, esto significa que compra los animales con bajo peso y los alimenta hasta que alcancen el peso suficiente para venderlos, e igualmente compra  ganado con el peso ideal y lo revende en las ferias ganaderas  de la zona.

Actualmente Miriam  está solicitando un micro crédito de un millón cincuenta mil colones (¢1.050.000)  para  continuar con este proyecto, con esto ella espera  seguir creciendo en su negocio y a la vez   mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Miriam es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 48 year old woman who lives with her family in the Canalette community in the Upala, San Carlos region, Alajuela province.  This province holds first place nationally for its coffee and sugarcane production.  It also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn) fruit, vegetables, and tubers.  It is one of the primary areas for raising livestock in the country.  This is especially true due to the production in the San Carlos canton.  

Also, the province is the site of the milk processing plants for the Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, which belongs to thousands of milk producers.  Additionally, in the area around the city of Alajuela a great number of businesses that manufacture for export have been established.  In Alajuela the free zones operates in El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos, and Bet.

Miriam has been farming for some time.  She buys and sells livestock for two reasons.  This means that she buys the animals at a low weight, and then she feeds them until they gain enough weight to sell them.  Also, she buys livestock at their ideal rate and resells the cattle at the livestock fairs in the zone.

Miriam is requesting a small loan for one million and fifty thousand colones in order to continue with this project.  With the loan she hopes to continue growing in her business.  At the same time she hopes to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Miriam is a member the Canalette communal bank, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level.  She also plans to actively participate in loan organization in her community.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Avargasaihan

texts.en:
Avargasaihan is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and a son in the capital city of Mongolia. His son is employed. His wife is a retiree. He has been running a taxi service business since 2001. During these years, he has raised the family income significantly. 

He has been driving his van for 11 years. He is an experienced driver who has a further plan to expand the business, but now his van needs to be repaired. Avargasaihan is an honest and hardworking man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by having my car repaired so that I could continue my business successfully." The total amount he is requesting is 1,550,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Yanaway

texts.en:
Yanaway is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and she has 6 children between the ages of 20 and 29, all of whom are attending school and live at home.

For the past 20 years Yanaway has been selling rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, plates, bowls) for her business.

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife both run a taxi service. He earns 65 to 70 thousand MNT a day and the business has been successful. 

He runs a construction decoration job in the summertime. He needs to buy some construction materials and some tools for the business to continue. Batsuh is a hardworking man who says, "I would like to continue the business so that I could raise more money in the summertime and save for my children."

The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy the construction decoration materials and tools.

loans.use: To buy construction decoration materials and tools.

loans.name: Celia Silfide

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Celia, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos todos mayores de edad, una hija vive en su casa la cual es madre soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo. El marido trabaja en el campo.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo el cual no gana mucho en el campo se dedica a la compra y venta de huevos, tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual realiza sus ventas, trabaja todos los días ya que es en su casa donde realiza esta actividad y no le causa ningún problema ya que realiza sus labores al tiempo que vende sus productos, ella lleva 4 años realizando esta labor la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco. 

Este crédito es para comprar huevos, fundas plásticas y cubetas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede ganar algo por su cuenta.
 
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y salud sobretodo.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the communal bank "San Esteban" meets every 15 days.  This is a place that is known for its traditional culture and also for being just minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Celia, 53, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage from which she has 4 children who are all adults.  One of her daughters lives in her house; she is a single mother and lives with her small child.  Celia's husband is a field worker.

In order to earn something on her own and thereby help her husband, who earns little working the fields, Celia has a business buying and selling eggs.  She has a small store in her house where she makes her sales.  She works every day, because her business is in her house and so this doesn't cause her any problems; she can do her household tasks at the same time that she is selling her products.  She has been doing this work for 4 years, and she started this business with the first loan that she received from this bank.

She will use this loan to buy eggs, plastic bags and buckets.  She has been with her communal bank for 4 years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she has been able to earn something on her own.

Her dreams are to have a bigger business and, most of all, to have good health.

loans.use: to buy eggs, plastic bags and buckets

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar  vive la señora María, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 20, 16 y 10 años  de edad, todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de fundas y embases de plástico en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja de jueves a domingos ya que es en estos días hay mas movimiento en el sector por cuanto son días de feria y salen las personas de los campos a surtirse de productos, trabaja desde las 8h0 hasta las 17h00 que cierra su negocio. Sus productos los va  a comprar a Guayaquil en una fábrica de plásticos. Lleva más de seis años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para ir a comprar fundas y envases plásticos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 16 años y  le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todos estos años.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio y sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “San Esteban” (St. Stephen) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

María, 44, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 20, 16 and 10 years old.  They all attend university, middle school and elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a business buying and selling plastic bags and containers in the center of the city.  She works Thursday to Sunday since these are the days with most commercial activity in the sector because they are market days and people from the countryside come by to stock up on merchandise.  She works from 8am until 5pm when she closes her business.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her products at a plastics factory.  She’s been in this business for more than six years and she does very well.

This loan is to buy plastic bags and containers.  She’s been in the communal bank for 16 years and likes it because of all the help she’s gotten over the years.  Her dream is to continue expanding the business and her sales.

loans.use: to buy bags and plastic containers.

loans.name: Ariel Mauricio

texts.es: El joven Ariel cuenta con su propio negocio como es Nintendo en la casa el cual es el el unico que existe en la colonia tiene buena demanda por los niños, ademàs posee el apoyo econòmico de su mamà, solicita su primer crèdito para comprar una computadora portatil y pagar un curso de computaciòn, como tambien para pagar 6 semestres de clases de Licenciatura en Ingles y  asi poder cumplir con su meta propuesta de superarse, su mayor sueño en la vida es culminar sus estudio y asi poder ejecer su profesion y cuando llegue a formar su propia familia tener algo que ofrecerles.
texts.en: Young Ariel has his own business: the only Nintendo game center in his neighborhood.  It is in high demand by the children.  His mother also supports him economically.  He’s asking for his first loan to buy a laptop computer and to pay for a computer course as well as to pay for six semesters leading to a Bachelor’s degree in English at a university so that he can reach his goal of improving himself.  His greatest dream is to complete his studies and to be able to work in his profession so that when he forms his own family he’ll have something to offer them.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Elvis Misael

texts.es: Elvis está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera de Mercadeo Y Publicidad. Dentro de algunos años se ve en un puesto de trabajo estable desempeñando sus conocimientos y siendo una fuente para sacar adelante la empresa para la que trabaje. Le inspiran sus padres ya que ellos se han sacrificado para darle una buena educación. Elvis es muy responsable y le gusta mucho su carrera y sueña que será alguien que contibuirá a su país de cualquier forma.
texts.en:
Elvis is requesting a loan to pay for his final fees to register his Marketing and Publicity degree. In a few years he sees himself in a stable job using his knowledge and being a source of progress for the company he’s working for.

His parents inspire him as they have sacrificed themselves to give him a good education. Elvis is very responsible, enjoys his career and dreams that he will be someone who contributes to his country in some way.

loans.use: pay his final fees to register his degree.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old John.  He is married and has three children, aged 4, 7 and 12. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help in their education. In 2009, John established his auto spare parts business. He began his business to generate income and to meet his family's needs.

Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. John has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional auto spare parts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, John plans to expand to the outskirts of town and to increase his stock and profit. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for auto spare parts.

loans.name: Isaura Esther

texts.es: La doctora Isaura Esther de 30 años de edad, labora como medico General desde hace 4 años, su esposo trabaja como administrador, ambos son bien trabajadores y comparten con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos , solicita crèdito para comprar un solar que le permitira tener acceso a la luz en la zona donde vive,  segun referencias esta pareja se caracteriza por ser bien responsables,su mayor sueño en la vida gozar de estabilidad laboral y ayudar a su familia
texts.en: Dr. Isaura Esther, 30, has worked as a General Physician for  the last four years.  Her husband works as an administrator.  They are both very hardworking and share household expenses and debts incurred.  She’s asking for her third loan to buy a solar panel that will allow her to have access to electricity in the zone where she lives.  According to references, this couple is characterized by being responsible.  Her greatest wish in life is to enjoy work stability and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis Enrique está cursando la carrera de Arquitectura, se encuentra en el último año y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Luis labora para una empresa de Telemarketing, y de esa manera costea los gastos de sus estudios. Su sueño es culminar sus estudios universitarios y reforzar su profesión con una maestría en estudio de Impacto Ambiental para implementar esos conocimientos en los futuros proyectos urbanísticos de Nicaragua.
texts.en: Luis Enrique is in his last year of Architecture and he’s requesting a loan to pay for the final fees to register his degree. Luis works for a telemarketing company to be able to pay for his studies. His dream is to finish his university studies and reinforce his career with a Master’s degree in Environmental Studies in order to implement that knowledge into Nicaragua’s future city-planning projects.

loans.use: pay for the final fees to register his degree.

loans.name: Franccis

texts.en: Franccis is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as stationery, snacks, sweets, etc. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of goods. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stationery, sweets, snacks, etc. His business goal is to venture into the vehicle transportation industry within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stationery, snacks, sweets etc

loans.name: Jahoska Maciel

texts.es: Para Jahoska su mayor inspiración para lograr sus metas es su familia y sobre todo su hermano ya que es el que más le ha apoyado en esta etapa de su vida y le gustaría retribuir todo lo que él ha hecho por ella. Jahoska se encuentra en el último año de la carrera de Contabilidad Pública, y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Espera trabajar en una empresa como contadora general ya que se ha esforzado mucho por concluir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jahoska’s greatest inspiration for reaching her goals is her family and above all her brother since he’s been her greatest supporter in this phase of her life and she’d like to reciprocate everything he’s done for her.

Jahoska is in the last year of Public Accounting and is asking for the loan to pay for her final course.  She hopes to work as a general accountant for a firm since she’s worked very hard to complete her studies.

loans.use: to pay fees.

loans.name: Bertilda Armanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Armanda. Tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, además de dos nietos de 10 y 9 años de edad que son como que si fueran de ella y estudian en escuela. Su esposo  es comerciante.

Ella junto a sus esposo desde hace mas de 15 años tienen una pequeña panadería la cual es muy visitada por sus clientes que desde la madrugada comprar el delicioso pan indispensable en la mesa de los ciudadanos, ella también prepara deliciosos pasteles los mismos que decora de acuerdo a la ocasión que sus clientes deseen. Allí también venden gaseosas, café y ciertos productos de primera necesidad. Trabajan junto a su esposo y sus hijos  todos los días desde las  5h00 hasta la noche que se encargan de dejar todo listo para el nuevo día.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, sal, manteca, azúcar y otros víveres necesarios para la fabricación del pan y sus pasteles. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son aumentar más su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “San Esteban” (St. Stephen) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Armanda, 58, lives in this place.  She’s married and has five children who are all now adults.  Two of them still live at home as well as two grandchildren who are 10 and 9 years old and are as if they were her own; they attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have had a small bakery for more than 15 years which is much visited by customers as early as dawn to buy delicious bread that’s indispensable at citizens’ tables.  She also makes delicious cakes that she decorates according to the occasion her customers desire.  They also sell soft-drinks, coffee and certain basic staple items there. She works alongside her husband and children every day from 5am until evening when they leave everything ready for the next day.

This loan is to buy flour, salt, shortening, sugar and other foodstuffs needed to prepare the bread and her cakes.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she’s been able to improve the business with the loans.  Her dreams are to increase the business more and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, shortening, sugar and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jesica Irene

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Irene, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
p> 
Ella desde hace mas de 8 años y con lo poco que tenia decidió adecuar un local en su casa en el mismo que surtió una  pequeña tienda de comestibles, en la actualidad además de víveres también vende ciertos artículos de bazar, papelería y  medicamentos permitidos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, allí además de ganarse el sustento de su familia también está al tanto de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos que requieren de muchos cuidados.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, carne, azúcar, aceite y varios productos más para surtir su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de tres años y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener la mejor tienda de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “San Esteban” (St. Stephen) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just a few minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Irene, 30, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 6 and 5 years old; both attend school.  Her husband is a farmer.

A little over 8 years ago and with the little she had she decided to set up a grocery store at home that she stocked with foodstuffs.  At present, in addition to food items she also sells household items, stationery supplies and permitted medicines.  She works every day from 6am until 7pm.  Besides earning her family’s sustenance there she’s also watching over her home and the needs of her children who require much care.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, sugar, oil and various other products to stock her store.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than three years and she likes it because interest rates are very low.  Her dream is to have the best store in town.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба жительница города Худжанд. Ей 37 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Матлуба имеет среднее образование. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки для вышивки.
texts.en: Matluba is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is 37 years old, divorced and has two children.  Matluba has a secondary education.  She is involved in sewing national dresses.  She has been in this type of business for eight years.  Matluba is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine for embroidery.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for embroidery

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 35 years old, single and lives in Buchanan. She stopped her education at grade 12. For the past 13 years, she has been selling charcoal in the market. She established the business from her savings. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат торгует на рынке более 10 лет. Она продает мужскую одежду. Первый свой кредит она получила в 2002 году. Сейчас она успешный предприниматель. Когда-то ее сын также как и другие ездил в Россию на заработки но дела шли не так как хотелось Ибодат. Она решила получить кредит  в большом размере и открыть еще одну точку на хорошем рынке для сына. Сейчас у них две торговые точки. Ибодат продает мелкие мужские вещи, как  головной убор и нижнее белье ,а у ее  сына более дорогая мужская одежда и хороший оборот в бизнесе. В настоящий момент она очень рада что существуют такие организации как КИВА ,что помогли ей и ее сыну найти хорошую прибыльную работу. Теперь ее сын находиться рядом с ней и со  своей семьей.
texts.en: Ibodat has been selling at a market for over ten years.  She sells men's clothing.  She obtained her first loan in 2002.  Now, Ibodat is a successful entrepreneur.  At some point, her son, just like others, went to Russia for work, but things were not going as Ibodat wanted.  She decided to obtain a large loan and open another retail outlet for her son at a good market.  Currently, they have two retail outlets.  Ibodat sells men's clothing accessories, such as hats and undergarments, and her son has more expensive men's clothing and good turnover in business.  At the present time, she is very glad that organizations like Kiva exist, and that they helped her and her son to find a good, profitable work.  Now, her son can stay near her and with his family.

loans.use: to purchase spring merchandise

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señorita Karina, tiene 25 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, junto con dos hermanos menores a quienes les ayuda para sus estudios.

Ella para obtener sus ingresos para sus gastos y también para ayudar con los estudios de sus dos hermanos menores se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa, zapatos y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por las tardes, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días, lleva más de 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, ella empezó vendiendo ropa y ahora ah aumentado sus productos para la venta.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes, entre otras cosas. Lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para su negocio y su vida personal.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hermanos terminen sus estudios y tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "San Esteban" meets every other week in they city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture, and also because it is only several minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Señorita Karina lives.  She is 25 years old and is single.  She lives in her parents' home with her two younger brothers whom she helps with their studies.

In order to earn income for her expenses, and also to be able to help with the education costs of her two younger brothers, Karina works in retail.  She sells clothing, shoes, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  Her sales method is going door-to-door, and she works every day in the afternoon.  She provides credit for her customers, and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been in this business for more than seven years, and it has been going very well for her.  She began by selling clothing, and has now increased the products that she sells.

This new loan is to purchase clothing, shoes, creams, and perfumes, among other things.  She has been part of the Communal Bank for more than two years, and likes it because the loans have helped her greatly in her business and personal life.

Her dreams are for her brothers to complete their studies, and to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, creams, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Tres Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una de las miembros  quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa de la fundacion paraguaya. Actualmente estan muy contentas dentro del programa y desean poder llegar al maximo nivel del programa.
La sra. Higina tiene un Almacen, ella quedo viuda hace varios años, y nos dice que vive con su hija y nietos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que siempre ha luchado por darle lo mejor a su familia y que no pasen por ninguna necesidad. Higinia tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azucar, bebidas, lacteos, verduras, carne y demás insumos, con lo que podrá abastacerse y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The contact person to start this committee was one of the members who invited and organized her friends to be part of Fundación Paraguaya’s program.  They are currently very happy within the program and want to reach the maximum level in the program.

Higinia has a store.  She was widowed several years ago and she tells us that she lives with her daughter and grandchildren.  She is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who has always striven to give her family the best so that they won’t go through any privations.  Higinia’s goal is to continue enlarging her store thus providing a better lifestyle for her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy sugar, soft-drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meat and other supplies to stock up to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft-drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meat and other supplies.

loans.name: Mohamed Jayah

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has three children, aged 21, 19 and 17. In 1997, Mohamed established his palm oil and local foodstuff business. He began his business to generate income and to meet his family's needs. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,150,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional palm oil and local rice. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand the shop from a makeshift store to a concrete building. The loan can increase his profit margin and make him sustainable. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for palm oil and local foodstuff.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадас занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Она замужем. Ей 25 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее муж помогает ей в продвижении деятельности. Она берет кредит для закупа семян картошки и пшеницы.
texts.en: Mukadas is involved in growing vegetables.  She has been in this business for six years.  She is 25 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband helps her with running this business.  Mukadas is requesting this loan to buy potato and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy potato and wheat seeds

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 27 years old. He lives in a small village of Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia with his parents, a sister, and a brother. Zaza is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of their income. His father works as a postman in the village and his mother is a housewife; his brother and sister are students. 

Zaza runs a family dairy farm with four milk cows and seven calves. He produces cheese and sells it in his and nearby villages. The family also owns 40 beehives with bee colonies. Zaza harvests honey two times a year and sells it in his and nearby villages as well. The family owns one hectare of land, where potatoes are grown. Zaza works hard during the whole year in the family farm with family members helping him. 

Zaza is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase potatoes for sowing. He will purchase good quality potatoes and receive a good harvest in the summer. Part of the loan will be used to repair his car. Zaza uses the car for transportation of agricultural products for sale to nearby villages. At the moment, the car is out of order. After the repair, it will be functional and Zaza will be able to take products to villages again.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and to repair the car.

loans.name: Corazón De Santa María Group

texts.es: La Sra. María de 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son independientes. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, detergentes, etc. desde hace 8 años. Comenzó con la venta de golosinas y refrescos con la idea de lograr abrir su propio negocio. También se dedica al servicio de costura desde hace 6 meses. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de agua, luz y teléfono; mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un restaurante en su propia casa. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio. María pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Corazón de Santa María”, grupo que se acaba de formar y está conformado por 6 personas. Le pusieron dicho nombre debido a que la zona en donde viven lleva el nombre de “Santa María”.
texts.en:
María, 42, has a spouse and three independent children.  She has been selling groceries like rice, sugar, soft-drinks, detergent, etc. for the last 8 years.  She started out selling snacks and soft-drinks with the idea of opening her own business.  She’s also been providing sewing services for the last 6 months.  

She currently spends her income on water, electricity and telephone while her husband covers food costs.  Her plan for the future is to open a restaurant at home.  She used the loan to buy merchandise for her store.
